Detailed Description

This is a namespace that wraps the global constants for SESWrapper.

Typedef Documentation

typedef struct SESWrapperNS::WAnalyzerRegion SESWrapperNS::AnalyzerRegion

Defines a region to be used for data acquisition.

An analyzer region must have been set through WRP_SetAnalyzerRegion() before starting an acquisition. The previously prepared region can be obtained through the WRP_CheckAnalyzerRegion() function. If the use_binding_energy variable has been set to true, all energies in this struct are assumed to be given as binding energies, otherwise they are kinetic energies. They default to kinetic energies. If binding energies are to be used, the excitation energy must also be set before using this struct.

See also:
WRP_CheckAnalyzerRegion(), WRP_SetAnalyzerRegion(), WRP_SetExcitationEnergy()
typedef struct SESWrapperNS::WDetectorInfo SESWrapperNS::DetectorInfo

Contains information about the detector.

The SES software currently supports two-dimensional detectors. The channel/slice members are usually given in pixels.

See also:
WRP_GetDetectorInfo()
typedef struct SESWrapperNS::WDetectorRegion SESWrapperNS::DetectorRegion

Contains information about the current detector region (a.k.a ROI).

See also:
WRP_GetDetectorRegion(), WRP_SetDetectorRegion()
